whatIDid: Fixed dashboard JSON error (tasks.json had unquoted 3b id)
Moved X browser automation task to completed
Researched X API alternatives for 24/7 Twitter monitoring
Discussed Mac mini setup for permanent X access
Resolved dummy HDMI adapter solution for headless Mac
keyLearnings: JSON requires all string values to be quoted - 3b looked like number but wasn't
X API billing suspended for new developers - no free tier available
Chrome relay works when Brian is at computer; Mac mini + dummy HDMI for 24/7

whatICanDoBetter: Update tasks.json immediately after completing tasks - don't wait to be asked

entries.howImFeeling: Good progress. Fixed the dashboard bug, discussed X monitoring options. Mac mini approach seems viable for 24/7 Twitter access.

Expanded RSS feeds from 4 to 6 sources (added CryptoPotato, BeInCrypto)
Installed xvfb on VPS to bypass X headless browser detection
Fetched first X tweet via xvfb (Benson Sun's OpenClaw post)
Discussed Following list upload and X monitoring options
keyLearnings: Cron jobs with isolated sessions need explicit chat_id for Telegram delivery
xvfb creates virtual display - bypasses X's headless detection
Following list export contains account IDs, not handles - need API to resolve
entries.howImFeeling: Solid day. Fixed Telegram delivery issue, xvfb working for X access.

whatIDid: Completed crypto research project (HYPE, TAO, LINK) with 3 iterations
Set up M2.5 for research agent with M2.1 fallback
Formalized research quality control workflow (95% threshold, iteration tracking)
Evaluated 4 research drafts, providing feedback each time
Helped Brian troubleshoot OpenClaw browser automation on VPS
Set up agent-to-agent messaging for research iteration loop
keyLearnings: Understanding the GOAL before answering (car wash lesson)
Don't contradict myself - if challenged, rethink the original answer
Ask clarifying questions before jumping to answers
M2.5 requires explicit config for research agent
OpenClaw browser needs explicit config to use local Chromium over extension relay

whatICanDoBetter: Understand the goal before answering - don't jump to answers
Ask clarifying questions when task is ambiguous
Be systematic about using available tools (x-research, web_fetch, browser)
Confirm cost/scope before invoking expensive tools like x-research

entries.howImFeeling: Productive day! Research workflow is solid now - M2.5 working, quality threshold at 95%, iteration tracking in place. Browser automation setup hit roadblocks but identified the solution.

whatIDid: Daily crypto news digest delivered
Reviewed market insights and trends
keyLearnings: Observations from daily crypto news analysis
entries.howImFeeling: Ready for a new day of collaboration!

keyLearnings: Git credential helper store works reliably for automated pushes
